Events.text: King Richard I of England gives Portsmouth its first Royal Charter.
Events.html: King Richard I of England gives Portsmouth its first Royal Charter.

Events.text: William de Braose is hanged by Prince Llywelyn the Great.
Events.html: William de Braose is hanged by Prince Llywelyn the Great.

Events.text: Otto the Merry, Duke of Austria, becomes Duke of Carinthia.
Events.html: Otto the Merry, Duke of Austria, becomes Duke of Carinthia.

Events.text: Anne Boleyn, Queen of England, is arrested and imprisoned on charges of adultery, incest, treason and witchcraft.
Events.html: Anne Boleyn, Queen of England, is arrested and imprisoned on charges of adultery, incest, treason and witchcraft.

Events.text: John Knox returns from exile to Scotland to become the leader of the nascent Scottish Reformation.
Events.html: John Knox returns from exile to Scotland to become the leader of the nascent Scottish Reformation.

Events.text: Mary, Queen of Scots, escapes from Loch Leven Castle.
Events.html: Mary, Queen of Scots, escapes from Loch Leven Castle.

Events.text: The King James Version of the Bible is published for the first time in London, England, by printer Robert Barker.
Events.html: The King James Version of the Bible is published for the first time in London, England, by printer Robert Barker.

Events.text: King Charles II of England grants a permanent charter to the Hudson's Bay Company to open up the fur trade in North America.
Events.html: King Charles II of England grants a permanent charter to the Hudson's Bay Company to open up the fur trade in North America.

Events.text: John Maitland becomes Duke of Lauderdale and Earl of March.
Events.html: John Maitland becomes Duke of Lauderdale and Earl of March.

Events.text: Outbreak of the Peninsular War: The people of Madrid rise up in rebellion against French occupation. Francisco de Goya later memorializes this event in his painting The Second of May 1808.
Events.html: Outbreak of the Peninsular War: The people of Madrid rise up in rebellion against French occupation. Francisco de Goya later memorializes this event in his painting The Second of May 1808.

Events.text: The Siege of Cuautla during the Mexican War of Independence ends with both sides claiming victory after Mexican rebels under José María Morelos y Pavón abandon the city after 72 days under siege by royalist Spanish troops under Félix María Calleja.
Events.html: The Siege of Cuautla during the Mexican War of Independence ends with both sides claiming victory after Mexican rebels under José María Morelos y Pavón abandon the city after 72 days under siege by royalist Spanish troops under Félix María Calleja.

Events.text: Marriage of Léopold of Saxe-Coburg and Princess Charlotte of Wales.
Events.html: Marriage of Léopold of Saxe-Coburg and Princess Charlotte of Wales.

Events.text: After anchoring nearby, Captain Charles Fremantle of HMS Challenger, declares the Swan River Colony in Australia.
Events.html: After anchoring nearby, Captain Charles Fremantle of HMS Challenger, declares the Swan River Colony in Australia.

Events.text: American Civil War: Stonewall Jackson is wounded by friendly fire while returning to camp after reconnoitering during the Battle of Chancellorsville. He succumbs to pneumonia eight days later.
Events.html: American Civil War: Stonewall Jackson is wounded by friendly fire while returning to camp after reconnoitering during the Battle of Chancellorsville. He succumbs to pneumonia eight days later.

Events.text: Peruvian defenders fight off the Spanish fleet at the Battle of Callao.
Events.html: Peruvian defenders fight off the Spanish fleet at the Battle of Callao.

Events.text: The April Uprising breaks out in Bulgaria.
Events.html: The April Uprising breaks out in Bulgaria.

Events.text: The Spanish Socialist Workers' Party is founded in Madrid by Pablo Iglesias.
Events.html: The Spanish Socialist Workers' Party is founded in Madrid by Pablo Iglesias.

Events.text: Cree and Assiniboine warriors win the Battle of Cut Knife, their largest victory over Canadian forces during the North-West Rebellion.
Events.html: Cree and Assiniboine warriors win the Battle of Cut Knife, their largest victory over Canadian forces during the North-West Rebellion.

Events.text: The Congo Free State is established by King Léopold II of Belgium.
Events.html: 1885 – The Congo Free State is established by King Léopold II of Belgium.

Events.text: Menelik II, Emperor of Ethiopia, signs the Treaty of Wuchale, giving Italy control over Eritrea.
Events.html: Menelik II, Emperor of Ethiopia, signs the Treaty of Wuchale, giving Italy control over Eritrea.

Events.text: Closing ceremony of the Intercalated Games in Athens, Greece.
Events.html: Closing ceremony of the Intercalated Games in Athens, Greece.

Events.text: General Motors acquires the Chevrolet Motor Company of Delaware.
Events.html: General Motors acquires the Chevrolet Motor Company of Delaware.

Events.text: The first game of the Negro National League baseball is played in Indianapolis.
Events.html: The first game of the Negro National League baseball is played in Indianapolis.

Events.text: Gleichschaltung: Adolf Hitler bans trade unions.
Events.html: Gleichschaltung: Adolf Hitler bans trade unions.

Events.text: Following the coup d'état against Iraq Crown Prince 'Abd al-Ilah earlier that year, the United Kingdom launches the Anglo-Iraqi War to restore him to power.
Events.html: Following the coup d'état against Iraq Crown Prince 'Abd al-Ilah earlier that year, the United Kingdom launches the Anglo-Iraqi War to restore him to power.

Events.text: World War II: Fall of Berlin: The Soviet Union announces the capture of Berlin and Soviet soldiers hoist their red flag over the Reichstag building.
Events.html: World War II: Fall of Berlin: The Soviet Union announces the capture of Berlin and Soviet soldiers hoist their red flag over the Reichstag building.

Events.text: World War II: Italian Campaign: General Heinrich von Vietinghoff signs the official instrument of surrender of all Wehrmacht forces in Italy.
Events.html: 1945 – World War II: Italian Campaign: General Heinrich von Vietinghoff signs the official instrument of surrender of all Wehrmacht forces in Italy.

Events.text: World War II: The US 82nd Airborne Division liberates Wöbbelin concentration camp finding 1000 dead prisoners, most of whom starved to death.
Events.html: 1945 – World War II: The US 82nd Airborne Division liberates Wöbbelin concentration camp finding 1000 dead prisoners, most of whom starved to death.

Events.text: World War II: A death march from Dachau to the Austrian border[1] is halted by the segregated, all-Nisei 522nd Field Artillery Battalion of the U.S. Army in southern Bavaria, saving several hundred prisoners.[2]
Events.html: 1945 – World War II: A death march from Dachau to the Austrian border[1] is halted by the segregated, all-Nisei 522nd Field Artillery Battalion of the U.S. Army in southern Bavaria, saving several hundred prisoners.[2]

Events.text: The world's first ever jet airliner, the De Havilland Comet 1 makes its maiden flight, from London to Johannesburg.
Events.html: The world's first ever jet airliner, the De Havilland Comet 1 makes its maiden flight, from London to Johannesburg.

Events.text: Tennessee Williams wins the Pulitzer Prize for Drama for Cat on a Hot Tin Roof.
Events.html: Tennessee Williams wins the Pulitzer Prize for Drama for Cat on a Hot Tin Roof.

links.title: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof

Events.text: Berthold Seliger launches a rocket with three stages and a maximum flight altitude of more than 100 kilometres near Cuxhaven. It is the only sounding rocket developed in Germany.
Events.html: Berthold Seliger launches a rocket with three stages and a maximum flight altitude of more than 100 kilometres near Cuxhaven. It is the only sounding rocket developed in Germany.

Events.text: Vietnam War: An explosion sinks the American aircraft carrier USS Card while it is docked at Saigon. A North Vietnamese frogman had placed a bomb on the ship. She is raised and returned to service less than seven months later.
Events.html: Vietnam War: An explosion sinks the American aircraft carrier USS Card while it is docked at Saigon. A North Vietnamese frogman had placed a bomb on the ship. She is raised and returned to service less than seven months later.

Events.text: First ascent of Shishapangma the fourteenth highest mountain in the world and the lowest of the Eight-thousanders.
Events.html: 1964 – First ascent of Shishapangma the fourteenth highest mountain in the world and the lowest of the Eight-thousanders.

Events.text: The British ocean liner Queen Elizabeth 2 departs on her maiden voyage to New York City.
Events.html: The British ocean liner Queen Elizabeth 2 departs on her maiden voyage to New York City.

Events.text: In the early morning hours a fire breaks out at the Sunshine Mine located between Kellogg and Wallace, Idaho, killing 91 workers.
Events.html: In the early morning hours a fire breaks out at the Sunshine Mine located between Kellogg and Wallace, Idaho, killing 91 workers.

Events.text: Falklands War: The British nuclear submarine HMS Conqueror sinks the Argentine cruiser ARA General Belgrano.
Events.html: Falklands War: The British nuclear submarine HMS Conqueror sinks the Argentine cruiser ARA General Belgrano.

Events.text: Chernobyl disaster: The City of Chernobyl is evacuated six days after the disaster.
Events.html: Chernobyl disaster: The City of Chernobyl is evacuated six days after the disaster.

Events.text: Hungary begins dismantling its border fence with Austria, which allows a number of East Germans to defect.
Events.html: Hungary begins dismantling its border fence with Austria, which allows a number of East Germans to defect.

links.title: Removal of Hungary's border fence with Austria

Events.text: A bus crashes in Gdańsk, Poland killing 32 people.
Events.html: A bus crashes in Gdańsk, Poland killing 32 people.

Events.text: During the Croatian War of Independence, the Army of the Republic of Serb Krajina fires cluster bombs at Zagreb, killing seven and wounding over 175 civilians.
Events.html: During the Croatian War of Independence, the Army of the Republic of Serb Krajina fires cluster bombs at Zagreb, killing seven and wounding over 175 civilians.

links.title: Army of the Republic of Serb Krajina

Events.text: The European Central Bank is founded in Brussels in order to define and execute the European Union's monetary policy.
Events.html: The European Central Bank is founded in Brussels in order to define and execute the European Union's monetary policy.

Events.text: Panamanian general election, 1999: Mireya Moscoso becomes the first woman to be elected President of Panama.
Events.html: Panamanian general election, 1999: Mireya Moscoso becomes the first woman to be elected President of Panama.

Events.text: President Bill Clinton announces that accurate GPS access would no longer be restricted to the United States military.
Events.html: President Bill Clinton announces that accurate GPS access would no longer be restricted to the United States military.

Events.text: The Yelwa massacre concludes. It began on 4 February 2004 when armed Muslims killed 78 Christians at Yelwa. In response, about 630 Muslims were killed by Christians on May 2nd.
Events.html: The Yelwa massacre concludes. It began on 4 February 2004 when armed Muslims killed 78 Christians at Yelwa. In response, about 630 Muslims were killed by Christians on May 2nd.

Events.text: Cyclone Nargis makes landfall in Burma killing over 138,000 people and leaving millions of people homeless.
Events.html: Cyclone Nargis makes landfall in Burma killing over 138,000 people and leaving millions of people homeless.

Events.text: Chaitén Volcano begins erupting in Chile, forcing the evacuation of more than 4,500 people.
Events.html: 2008 – Chaitén Volcano begins erupting in Chile, forcing the evacuation of more than 4,500 people.

Events.text: Osama bin Laden, the suspected mastermind behind the September 11 attacks and the FBI's most wanted man, is killed by the United States special forces in Abbottabad, Pakistan.
Events.html: Osama bin Laden, the suspected mastermind behind the September 11 attacks and the FBI's most wanted man, is killed by the United States special forces in Abbottabad, Pakistan.

Events.text: An E. coli outbreak strikes Europe, mostly in Germany, leaving more than 30 people dead and many others sick from the bacteria outbreak.
Events.html: 2011 – An E. coli outbreak strikes Europe, mostly in Germany, leaving more than 30 people dead and many others sick from the bacteria outbreak.

Events.text: The 41st Canadian federal election is held, in which the governing Conservative Party, led by incumbent Prime Minister Stephen Harper, increases their number of seats from a minority to a majority.
Events.html: 2011 – The 41st Canadian federal election is held, in which the governing Conservative Party, led by incumbent Prime Minister Stephen Harper, increases their number of seats from a minority to a majority.

Events.text: A pastel version of The Scream, by Norwegian painter Edvard Munch, sells for $120 million in a New York City auction, setting a new world record for a work of art at auction.
Events.html: A pastel version of The Scream, by Norwegian painter Edvard Munch, sells for $120 million in a New York City auction, setting a new world record for a work of art at auction.

Events.text: Two mudslides in Badakhshan, Afghanistan, leave up to 2,500 people missing.
Events.html: Two mudslides in Badakhshan, Afghanistan, leave up to 2,500 people missing.

Births.html: Yongle Emperor of China (d. 1424)
